citation.article-title: Hirschia maritima sp. nov., isolated from seawater
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Hirschia maritima sp. nov.
Hirschia maritima (ma.ri′ti. ma. L. fem. adj. maritima of the marine environment).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-negative, oxidase-positive and catalase-positive.
Vegetative cells produce a prostheca (0.06–0.1 μm in diameter) and reproduce by budding.
Mature cells are spherical, oval- or rod-shaped and measure about 0.6–1.1×1.2–1.3 μm.
At maturity, both the vegetative cell and the bud produce one or more flagella.
Colonies are circular, convex, entire, orange and measure 0.5–0.8 mm in diameter after 5 days incubation.
Growth does not occur on any medium supplemented with natural seawater or artificial sea salts except for MA.
Grows at 10–30 °C (optimum, 30 °C), at pH 6.1–10.1 (optimum, pH 8.1–9.1) and on MA supplemented with 1 % (w/v) NaCl.
Produces a non-diffusible carotenoid pigment [λmax=460 nm in methanol/acetone (1 : 1, v/v)], but bacteriochlorophyll a is absent.
Degrades DNA and starch but not casein, chitin, CM-cellulose, elastin, gelatin, hypoxanthine, dl-tyrosine or xanthine.
Positive for aesculin degradation and β-galactosidase, but negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase and urease (API 20NE).

Enzyme activities for alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase are positive, but esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosamidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are negative (API ZYM).

In the Biolog GN2 system, l-arabinose, d-fructose, myo-inositol, d-mannitol, d-mannose, d-psicose, d-sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, methyl pyruvate, methyl succinate, acetic acid, d-gluconic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, l-alanyl glycine, l-glutamic acid, l-serine, 2-aminoethanol, glycerol, Tween 40, Tween 80, l-alanine, l-proline, α-d-glucose, d-mannitol (weak), γ-hydroxybutyric acid (weak), phenylethylamine (weak), putrescine (weak) and 2,3-butanediol (weak) are oxidized.

The following carbon substrates are not oxidized: α-cyclodextrin, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, l-arabinose, myo-inositol, formic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid, malonic acid, citric acid, sebacic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, d-alanine, l-alaninamide, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-leucine, l-phenylalanine, d-serine, l-serine, γ-aminobutyric acid, 2-aminoethanol, glycerol, dl-α-glycerol phosphate and d-glucose α-6-phosphate.
meso-Diaminopimelic acid is the diagnostic diamino acid of the cell-wall peptidoglycan.
The predominant quinone is Q-10.
The only polar lipid detected is phosphatidylglycerol.
The major cellular fatty acids are components included in summed feature 7 and C16 : 0.
The type strain, GSW-2T (=DSM 19733T=JCM 14974T), was isolated from seawater taken from the seashore of Jeju, Republic of Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 44.5 mol%.
